Content-Type: text/plain; charset="Windows-1252"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Some Heritrix versions run a JMX Agent on a default port of 8849. The "java=
.net.BindException: Address already in use" exception means there is alread=
y something running on port 8849 when you attempt to start Heritrix, so it =
is not available to be used.

You could check what is running there via the=
 commandline:
 $ lsof -i:8849

What version of Heritrix are you using? I be=
lieve the most recent Heritrix 3.X releases do not use JMX, and should not =
need port 8849, so one option to solve your problem might be to use Heritri=
x 3.2.0: https://webarchive.jira.com/wiki/display/Heritrix/Release+Notes+-+=
Heritrix+3.2.0.

If you need to use the version of Heritrix you already hav=
e, you could specify that Heritrix use a different port for the JMX agent b=
y setting the JMX_PORT environment variable before running Heritrix (more i=
nfo here https://webarchive.jira.com/wiki/display/Heritrix/HOWTO+Launch+Her=
itrix).

Lauren Ko
UNT Libraries
________________________________________
F=
rom: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com [archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com]

: Tuesday, September 6, 2016 10:58 PM

ubject: [archive-crawler] Trying to run Heritrix

Hi,

We are trying to ins=
tall and run Heritrix in Linux environment. Have installed but there is iss=
ue running Heritrix. Looking at the log file, we are seeing these errors.

=
Error: Exception thrown by the agent : java.rmi.server.ExportException: Por=
t already in use: 8849; nested exception is:
        java.net.BindException=
: Address already in use

Any advice?

Thanks.

Regards,
Ng Pui San
